revised_title: Papers Read to the Royal Society of London in June 1899
tldr: This article presents a summary of papers read to the Royal Society of London in June 1899. Topics discussed include a comparison of platinum and gas thermometers, the morphology and distribution of an organism found in the tsetse fly disease, the orientation of Greek temples, the efficiency of positively and negatively charged ions as condensation nuclei, and the orbit of the Leonid stream.
